Our team is closely monitoring the situation, and we will provide updates as soon as the service is stable. Thank you for your patience.

We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your patience during this time. Our team will continue to keep a close eye on the situation to ensure everything remains stable. Please continue to monitor our status page for further updates.

incidents.name: Default Router communication to AWS Uplink degraded

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

On March 15th, at 9:01 AM Pacific, Apollo performed maintenance on our AWS Uplink configuration delivery system. The change was to migrate our internal loadbalancers to best practice Edge optimized routing.

In doing so, we removed a route used by default Routers, thus making their fallback to AWS fail with a 4XX.

From our observations of our systems, this impacted some of our traffic but with our knowledge of our rates of success/failure with our GCP Uplink, we do not believe any Routers running in our customer's systems were critically impacted.

No Apollo Gateways were impacted by this change at all.

On March 23rd, at around 2:30 PM Pacific, we patched this issue and confirmed seeing our 4XX error rate drop back to almost 0%.

We apologize for any inconvenience this caused by this escaped bug, and will be working in the coming days on our postmortem. As always, we appreciate your patience!

components.name: Uplink
components.description: Studio managed Supergraph Schema Delivery. Apollo Gateway (v 0.34+) uses Uplink to fetch routing configuration dynamically from the Apollo schema registry.

incident_updates.body: Studio UI was fully degraded at 4:26 PM EST and recovered at 4:48 PM EST. Other platform services such as Checks were unaffected.
This incident has been resolved.

Between February 16th, at 21:24 UTC and February 22nd at 18:52 UTC, Apollo had a bug in our GCS Schema Delivery Pipeline.

To be impacted by this bug, customers would need to:

- Be on an Apollo Gateway version before 0.45.0, and have their Gateway set to receive SuperGraph configuration via GCS
    - NOTE: In Apollo Gateway version 0.34.0 we changed SuperGraph delivery to default to Uplink
- Be on Federation version 1.0
- Make a change to a Subgraph URL but NOT make a change to their Subgraph's schema

If you believe you fall into the above camp, you will be able to resolve this issue on your end by making any deployment whatsoever to the variant in question.

Please reach out to support for any further questions.

components.name: Uplink
components.description: Studio managed Supergraph Schema Delivery. Apollo Gateway (v 0.34+) uses Uplink to fetch routing configuration dynamically from the Apollo schema registry.

incidents.name: Cloud Router Serverless offering experiencing inconsistent availability

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. We haven't observed any more network connectivity problems with our upstream vendor.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.

We have been able to confirm that all "impacted" Serverless Cloud Routers will have at worst a few milliseconds of latency added to their routing. Having this impact is also highly improbable, but definitely possible.

At this time we are quickly moving to fix the final impacted Serverless Cloud Routers, but are reducing the severity of this incident as we have been able to confirm the scope is not dramatically hampering most traffic.

We have gotten an update from our upstream vendor and all new Cloud Routers on the Serverless offering will not be impacted here. Additionally, we have been given steps to mitigate all impacted Serverless Cloud Routers, and will be moving forward with this process shortly.

Our upstream vendor appears to be having network connectivity problems which are impacting particular hosts in a particular region.  It does not impact all hosts in the impacted region and we are currently awaiting resolution or mitigation with our upstream vendor.

Some user's Cloud Routers on the Serverless offering are failing to come online.  Additionally, some existing deployments may have disrupted or intermittent network connectivity.  We are investigating with our upstream partner to determine the source of the outage.  We will post additional updates as soon as possible.

incident_updates.body: For approximately 1 hour Studio may have been unable to fetch an organization's list of graphs from our back end services. We reverted the bad change, and have since fixed the underlying issue.  We apologize for any interruption this may have caused.

Checks and Launches were delayed from 2:15-2:45 PM EST due to an issue where our federation pipeline was deployed out of order. We have since resolved the deploy order issue and systems should be functional. If you have any questions, please reach out to our support team.

As always, we appreciate your patience.

Our metrics ingestion lag has recovered, and our operations check data storage system latency is no longer elevated. We are continuing to monitor our systems for further discrepancies.

We've determined that while the storage system service was non-functional, our metrics ingestion lag also increased. This lag has been recovering since we implemented the fix, and continues to recover.

We believe the delay is due to increased latency in our operations check data storage system, due to an issue in one of the constituent services. We have fixed the issue with the constituent service, and the storage system is recovering.

incident_updates.body: We've seen our ingestion reporting stable operational aspects for the last little while. As such, we're closing this out. Thanks for the patience folks!

We have identified the issue, and our metrics reporting endpoint should be functional at this time. Metrics and trace data may have been lost from 6:45AM-7AM PT. We are currently monitoring for further issues.

Our reporting endpoint is completely down and returning 5XXs at this time. There is likely metrics loss, and we are currently investigating.

It's possible your Apollo Server or Apollo Gateway instances may have increased memory usage at this time due to buffering metrics and trace data. If this is causing your fleet to run out of memory/crash, we recommend disabling the usage reporting plugin at this time. You can find guidance on this at https://www.apollographql.com/docs/apollo-server/v3/api/plugin/usage-reporting#disabling-the-plugin

incidents.name: GraphQL API experiencing high latency and errors

incident_updates.body:
Our GraphQL API has not experienced latency anomalies for the past 2 hours, and we believe the incident to be resolved.

The effect of this incident is that from 9:30AM PT to 9:00PM PT, our GraphQL API experienced high latency, leading to timeouts in several components of our systems. This includes Studio, Rover CLI commands, and schema reporting. The root cause of this outage has been identified as a combination of database resource exhaustion and internal scaling issues.

We have collected initial notes during this incident that already point to improvements we can make on our side, and we will be conducting a thorough postmortem to ensure that such an incident does not occur again. Thank you to everyone for your patience and support. We are committed to meeting high standards of reliability and excellence and using the learnings from this incident to improve.
We have identified the causes of the latency, and have implemented fixes. We will continue to monitor our GraphQL API latency for anomalies.

Our GraphQL API is experiencing increased latency, and we are currently investigating the cause. You may experience Studio UI fail to load as a result, in addition to high latency when running Rover commands that connect to Studio.

components.name: GraphQL API
components.description: The API that supports reading metrics, schemas, client metadata, publishing and validating schemas.

components.name: Studio UI
components.description: The Studio SaaS Frontend UI.

incident_updates.body:
UPDATE (11/3/2022): Due to the way in which traces and stats are processed, it's possible that servers which were reporting usage to Apollo during this incident are in a state where reporting raw traces to Apollo Studio is disabled. If you are not seeing traces in Apollo Studio and have traces enabled for a percentage of requests, we recommend restarting any such servers to regain trace-reporting functionality. Reporting aggregate statistics is unaffected.

---

Upon the most recent update, metric ingestion has returned to a stable state and new metrics are being processed. 

Overall, the result of this incident is that between 9:30am to 1pm Pacific, metrics were unable to be collected and have been permanently lost. Users will see a gap of data for this time in graphs within Studio as well as any other integrated analytics tools (e.g. Datadog). Further, some users may have experienced issues in buffering pending metrics reports during this outage, depending on their configuration. 

The root cause of this outage has been identified as a large scale event, along with several additional factors which caused such a long delay in our ability to restore service. We have collected initial notes during this incident that already point to improvements we can make on our side, and we will be conducting a thorough postmortem to ensure that such an incident does not occur again. Thank you to everyone for your patience and support. We are committed to meeting high standards of reliability and excellence and using the learnings from this incident to improve.
We're observing increased latency in our GraphQL API, and are currently investigating. Our metrics ingestion endpoint should be normal, and we're continuing to monitor success rate.

We have released a change to no longer serve any rate limits for our metrics ingestion endpoint. We are continuing to monitor the traffic to ensure that our success rate for this endpoint remains close to 100%, and we expect things to be returning to normal.

We have successfully rolled out an update that is causing responses to metrics submissions to either succeed (200) or fail with a rate-limit status code (429). For users that have been experiencing issues in their infrastructure related to buffering these reports, we recommend restarting any servers that are emitting these metrics. We are currently accepting 50% of traffic and gradually increasing the scale of metrics traffic that we accept to ensure continued service.

We understand that this incident caused a variety of issues for our customers, and we are already underway at collecting action items and follow-ups. Thank you for your patience as we resolve the underlying issues.
We implemented a fix for Studio UI and latency is trending downwards back to healthy levels.  Studio UI should be operational again and we'll continue to monitor its state.
Latency for our API has drastically increased and Studio-UI takes a long time to load. We are continuing to investigate and appreciate your continued patience
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We're seeing increased latency from our GraphQL API, which is causing Studio to be slow to load
We are in the middle of restarting some of our systems, you may experience 429s instead of 5XXs while this is occurring.
Our reporting endpoint has mostly not been accepting stats and traces for the duration of the incident. Our latency for our GraphQL API has also seen a significant increase.
We've determined the cause of the issue and are working on a fix.
Our API endpoint for reporting metrics and some parts of our GraphQL endpoint are experiencing increased latency and errors, we are currently investigating.

incident_updates.body: We were experiencing an incident affecting only in Uplink where new API keys in Apollo Studio created after 2:15 PM PST and before 4:00 PM PST was not usable. Because of the nature of the issue in our system, API keys that were deleted after 2:15 PM PST were still usable. We have since fixed the issue and are working to add more testing and metrics. We want to thank you for your patience and sincerest apologies to anyone who was affected.
This incident has been resolved.

We have rolled out a fix and most metrics has recovered back to healthy  levels. We will continue to watch to ensure the delay remains minimal and update this page as appropriate. Thank you all for your patience
We are currently investigating an issue where we're noticing an increase in latency and error rates for rover command and Studio UI operations.

incidents.name: Delay in running subgraph schema checks with new versions of rover

incident_updates.body:
Over a 24 hour period, there were a number of long delays (> 60 seconds) for checks to complete, which may have caused timeouts for users depending on their client timeout configurations. These checks did all complete and update any relevant status in the UI and via GitHub, though they may have failed CI jobs depending on configuration. 

We apologize for any disruption this may have caused for your day-to-day operations, and we have put a fix in place (a missing database index) to avoid future problems, as well as put monitoring in place to identify these problems before causing problems for users.

incidents.name: High lag in forwarding operation metrics from Apollo Studio to Datadog

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have rolled out a fix and are beginning to see most metrics transmission return to a near realtime delay. We will continue to watch to ensure the delay remains minimal and update this page as appropriate. Thank you all for your patience

We have identified that we are lagging in sending metrics to Datadog by about 30 minutes for a majority of customers. We are in the process of rolling out changes that we believe will help combat this lag as well as adding more observability ourselves to notice and address this issue more promptly in the future.
We are currently investigating an issue that may be affecting some customers where data is delayed in forwarding from Apollo Studio to Datadog.

components.name: Datadog Forwarding
components.description: A feature of Apollo Studio that allows users to forward metrics observed via Apollo's telemetry pipeline to their Datadog instance(s).

incident_updates.body:
Lag is happy, and we are all caught up.

Thanks as always for your patience!

We've been able to identify the issues are not stemming solely from DataDog revoking keys. Our logs were cluttered with keys which had, in face, been revoked and thus masked the underlying issues we had on our services with lag. At this time we are seeing the lag dropping across our infrastructure and will update and close here in 20 minutes if this trend continues.

We apologize for the inconvenience, and the red herring for a fix presented earlier.

We've confirmed that while for many graphs we are seeing elevated error rates talking with DataDog, we are still seeing successful metrics being sent for most graphs. At this time we are investigating whether our own internal monitoring is simply finicky, or whether we are seeing evidence of a number of client API tokens expiring/being revoked by DataDog.

If you are experiencing a delay in your DataDog metrics from Studio, please re-enable your API keys as a mitigation strategy. Docs for how to do this can be found here: https://www.apollographql.com/docs/studio/datadog-integration/
We are continuing to investigate this issue at this time.

We are currently seeing an elevated level of errors trying to forward Apollo Studio insights metrics to DataDog. At this time we're still investigating why this is occurring and what steps can be taken on our end to mitigate.

We will update again in 20 minutes.

incidents.name: Delays in Updating GitHub Statuses for Check Workflows

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We're seeing regular delay for updating Schema Checks through to GitHub statuses.

As always, we appreciate your patience. If you're seeing continued lag, we encourage you to open a support ticket!

Our DB CPU is now back to a regular operational level and we are working through our backlog of messages. We are going to start scaling up our fleet and observe the impact to our queues.

We will update in 20 minutes.

We have implemented the new index in our production environment and are awaiting statistics to confirm its impact. The overall end customer impact here appears to be rather small with our message backlog actually being held off in this degraded state quite well.

We will update again in 20 minutes once we have adequate metrics.

We have identified an errant database query and are working to implement a fix, most likely by adding another index, which should alleviate pressure on our database and allow us to scale up our full fleet of services devoted to updating GitHub statuses.

We are still processing GitHub status updates, though we are still seeing some delay.

We will update again in 20 minutes.

We are currently seeing an increased latency in updating statuses for Apollo Studio Workflows. We are actively working on this issue,  and will update again herein 15 minutes as we know more.

As always, we appreciate your patience.

incident_updates.body:
We believe the incident preventing users from logging in with their SSO providers (like Okta or PingOne) to be resolved.  Again, no CLI or API access usage using graph tokens was impacted during this time, only login workflows through the Studio web interface.

We don't believe it is necessary but ‚Äî as this was a login problem ‚Äî if you continue to experience troubles logging in, please try using your browser's private browsing mode.  If the issues persist, contact our support team.

We will be taking measures on our end to reduce the potential of this happening in the future and we appreciate your patience during the outage.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
Thanks to a fix implemented with our upstream identity provider, our SSO login is working again as of about 20 minutes ago.  We will continue to monitor the situation.

Our identity provider has identified the reason why their systems are refusing our attempts to negotiate SSO logins for our users.

We are working with their teams to find a resolution.  We apologize for the inconvenience and appreciate your patience.

Our users continue to experience errors when attempting to log in with SSO.  We have verified that Studio Graph tokens and CLI usage for tokens which have already been created continue to work. 

We are in communication with our identity provider and we will provide more updates as soon as they are available.

We are currently investigating reports of problems logging in with SSO providers (e.g., Okta, PingOne, etc.).  Logins with GitHub and email/password combinations are working correctly and this only affects SSO logins.

incident_updates.body: We have seen no new issues with SSO functionality. Thank you for your patience.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results closely. We will keep this status page updated with any developments/progress during this process. Thank you again for your patience.
Certain users are unable to log in to Apollo Studio via SSO after logging out. We are currently investigating this issue, and we will keep this page updated. Thank you for your patience.

incidents.name: Increased Login Issues, and Data Availability Problems

incident_updates.body:
We have seen no new issues with Notifications and are busy working on a number of PRs to mitigate this issue in the future.

As always, we appreciate your patience

We are now monitoring our notifications services as we have restarted what appeared to be wedged workers. We'll be observing this over the course of the day and will implementing root hardening and fixes.

We will leave this statuspage open for 15 more minutes and close if the current stability continues.
The login issues we saw were coincidental, and we were able to narrow our concerns for impact to our notifications services.

We are currently investigating an increased number of login failures, and what appears to be data unavailability problems. We are unsure if these are related, or purely coincidental, but will work to keep everyone in the loop here. Expect an update in 15 minutes.

incident_updates.body: We have resolved this issue and transactional emails should be sending again. We will be implementing further improvements throughout the week to ensure this doesn't happen in the future. Thank you for your patience as we continue to improve the stability of these systems.

We will keep this status page updated with any developments/progress during this process. Thank you again for your patience.

The functionality for inviting users to your organization via email in Apollo Studio is not functional. Please utilize the shareable invite links feature to invite new users to your organization during this time. We apologize for this inconvenience, and we will keep this status page updated with any developments/progress. 

Thank you so much for your patience, as we work through this matter and put the proper mitigations in place.

incident_updates.body: The backlog has been processed, and the lag should be back to zero.

There is currently significant lag in updating api tokens that can be used to query uplink. Users who create or delete an api token won't be able to see the effect take place currently.

We have identified the issue and are working on bringing down the backlog of api token updates.

components.name: Uplink
components.description: Studio managed Supergraph Schema Delivery. Apollo Gateway (v 0.34+) uses Uplink to fetch routing configuration dynamically from the Apollo schema registry.

incidents.name: Connection exhaustion errors when interacting with the Apollo Registry

incident_updates.body: Users trying to run into "remaining connection slots are reserved for non-replication superuser connections" error message between 17:10 UTC and 17:40 UTC due to services scaling up while getting deployed and exhausting the postgres connection pool. We are putting mitigations in place to ensure this issue doesn't appear again with future deployments.
This incident has been resolved.
Our systems have now sent the delayed emails and we'll continue to monitor for any other delays in our messaging systems.

Beginning around 5:22am PST, an issue has been identified with emails being sent through Mailgun due to their systems being down (https://status.mailgun.com). Emails have not been lost, they're simply delayed and waiting in queue to be sent once Mailgun comes back online.

We apologize for any inconvenience. This means that any emails such as reset password, sign up or invitations will be delayed. We'll keep this status page updated with any developments and progress.

Thank you for your patience.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. Our team will be looking further into this during a postmortem later this week. As always, we appreciate your patience as we continue to grow to meet your needs. Have a good night folks!
We're seeing early signs of success with our rollback and are moving this to monitoring. We will keep our previous update's timeframe for providing feedback.

We have identified an errant deploy with what appears to be an escaped bug. We have rolled this back and are waiting to see the impact from this. We will update again in the next 15 minutes to provide more context. As always, we appreciate your pateince.
We are seeing an elevated number of checks requests failing in our API with ‚Äúhistorical check data" as the errored response.

components.name: Schema Checks
components.description: The Schema Checks feature enabling user workflows for commands like `rover graph check`, and `rover subgraph check`.

incidents.name: Lag in updating schemas in Uplink

incident_updates.body: All monitors are green. Things are fully operational and stable. We will be scheduling a post mortem and following up on this in the days to come. Thanks as always for your patience, and have a great weekend!

We are seeing everything functioning correctly across all mirrors. Lag has dropped to 0 for the vast majority of graphs. We will leave this open for another 10 minutes while we monitor further, but we are pretty confident this is over. Thanks folks!

We are seeing our main Uplink endpoints returning to normal. We are still waiting on all of our health checks to our multi-cloud mirrors to resolve before declaring this resolved. We expect this to be at most another 15 minutes. As always, we appreciate your patience.
We've identified the source of this error and are attempting a fix. We will know more in about 15 minutes.

We are currently investigating an issue where we're seeing lag in updating schemas in Uplink. We are seeing no evidence that this is impacting currently served schemas, and thus, no gateways or routers should be impacted.

components.name: Uplink
components.description: Studio managed Supergraph Schema Delivery. Apollo Gateway (v 0.34+) uses Uplink to fetch routing configuration dynamically from the Apollo schema registry.

incidents.name: Contract variant launches failing to start

incident_updates.body: Due to a misconfiguration in Studio backend services, launches for contract variants may have silently failed to start, beginning at approximately 12PM PT on 2022-06-03. The misconfiguration has since been resolved. However, to ensure your contract variant is up-to-date, you may need to manually trigger a launch for your contract variant by making a no-op change to one of your subgraph schemas (such as changing whitespace in a comment or description). We apologize for the delay in resolving this misconfiguration, and thank you for your patience during this incident.

incidents.name: Users unable to use @specifiedBy in managed federation 1.0 graphs

incident_updates.body: This issue has been resolved.

Users using federation 1.0 composition and `@specifiedBy` directives would get an error saying `Unknown directive "@specifiedBy".`. 

This was due to a misconfiguration in federation 1.0 validation logic which used graphql-js 15.0.0 to validate the generated supergraph core schema rather than using graphql-js 15.7.2. 

This bug was introduced at 18:20 UTC May 23, and a fix was released at 08:53 UTC May 24.

components.name: Schema Publishing
components.description: The Schema Publishing feature which is leveraged by tools like Server auto-reporting, `rover graph publish`, and `rover subgraph publish`.

incidents.name: Users unable to override schema check configuration when calling API directly

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are in the process of rolling out a fix to allow numeric overrides.
We are in the midst of validating a fix that we believe will resume accepting numeric input for `from` and `to` overrides for direct API callers.

We are currently in the midst of resolving an issue around input coercion for users of schema checks that are calling our API directly or using the (legacy) Apollo Language Server to perform schema checks. If you are affected, you may receive errors indicating that your `historicParameters.from` and `historicParameters.to` could not be parsed. 

To resolve, please wrap these values in quotation marks `"`. We are in the midst of fixing the issue to accept numeric input via the API and will update his page as we make progress.

components.name: Schema Checks
components.description: The Schema Checks feature enabling user workflows for commands like `rover graph check`, and `rover subgraph check`.

incidents.name: Users unable to override schema check configuration via the CLI

incident_updates.body: Users that tried to override schema check configuration via Rover, the legacy Apollo CLI client, or used the API directly received 400 errors due to a misconfiguration in scalar parsing. The issue has now been fixed. If you are currently overriding schema check `from` and `to` values manually, please ensure that these are passed as string types rather than integers.
